p: Of the 58 reports analyzed, 6 (10.3%) reported data from Brazil, including the Northeast region and the state of Ceará; 41 (70.6%) reported data for only the city of Fortaleza; seven (12%) reported data for the state of Ceará; and four (6.8%) reported data for cities in the interior of the state (one in Icaraí (Caucaia); one in Juazeiro do Norte, Crato and Barbalha; one in Tauá and one in Pacoti) ( Tables 1 and 2). Of the reports analyzed, 39 (67.2%) included only adults, 16 (27.5%) included children and adults, and 3 (5.2%) included only children 15- 17.
